content.en: Algorithmic LIBS Enhancement: Scientists have been exploring the use of algorithms to improve the accuracy of laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS) for analyzing materials. These algorithms, such as the Calibration-Free algorithm and the internal reference method, aim to correct for self-absorption effects and improve the quantitative analysis of elemental composition in various materials, including steel and archaeological findings. By optimizing plasma temperature estimation and exploiting self-absorption, these algorithms show promise in enhancing the performance of LIBS analysis.
content.da: Algoritmisk Forbedring af LIBS: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer til at forbedre nøjagtigheden af laserinduceret nedbrydningsspektroskopi (LIBS) til analyse af materialer. Disse algoritmer, såsom den kalibreringsfri algoritme og den interne referencemetode, sigter mod at korrigere for selvabsorberingseffekter og forbedre den kvantitative analyse af elementær sammensætning i forskellige materialer, herunder stål og arkæologiske fund. Ved at optimere plasma-temperatur-estimering og udnytte selvabsorbering viser disse algoritmer lovende resultater i at forbedre ydeevnen af LIBS-analyse.
